qas.question: When was the infrastructure of the postal service destroyed?
What airport is home to the Emirates post mail hub?
What Airport delivered the mail before 2003?

plausible_answers.text: Italy, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, Sweden, Switzerland and Canada

qas.question: Which Western country did Somalia partner with?
What country did the Somali Post parner with before the civil war?

plausible_answers.text: The national postal infrastructure was completely destroyed during the civil war

qas.question: Why did Somalia Post partner with Western Countries?
Where is the Somalia Post mail transit Hub?

context: <b5_0>The national postal infrastructure was completely destroyed <a0_0>during the civil war<b5_0/><a0_0/>. In order to fill the vacuum, Somali Post signed an agreement in 2003 with the <b4_0>United Arab Emirates<b4_0/>' Emirates Post to process mail to and from Somalia. Emirates Post's mail transit hub at the <a1_0><b2_0><b6_0>Dubai International<a1_0/> Airport<b6_0/><b2_0/> was then used to forward mail from Somalia to the UAE and various Western destinations, including <b3_0>Italy, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, Sweden, Switzerland and Canada<b3_0/>.
